title: Ticket #5739: metaknobs should have arguments
description:
It is awkward if not impossible to use config metaknobs to help configure a collector tree or HAD. Both of these would be cleaner and easier if metaknobs had support for argument passing.

So you could do something like this 

config file fragment
use FEATURE : CollectorNode(2, 9702), CollectorNode(3, 9703)
And it would expand to this 
expansion of the above config
COLLECTOR2 = $(COLLECTOR)
COLLECTOR2_ARGS = -f -local-name COLLECTOR2 -p 9702
COLLECTOR2.COLLECTOR_LOG = $(LOG)/Collector2Log
DAEMON_LIST = $(DAEMON_LIST) COLLECTOR2
COLLECTOR3 = $(COLLECTOR)
COLLECTOR3_ARGS = -f -local-name COLLECTOR3 -p 9703
COLLECTOR3.COLLECTOR_LOG = $(LOG)/Collector3Log
DAEMON_LIST = $(DAEMON_LIST) COLLECTOR3
When the metaknob $FEATURE.CollectorNode is defined as 
$FEATURE.CollectorNode 
COLLECTOR$(1) = $(COLLECTOR)
if $(2?)
  COLLECTOR$(1)_ARGS = -f -local-name COLLECTOR$(1) -p $(2)
else
  COLLECTOR$(1)_ARGS = -f -local-name COLLECTOR$(1) -sock collector$(1)
endif
COLLECTOR$(1).COLLECTOR_LOG = $(LOG)/Collector$(1)Log
DAEMON_LIST = $(DAEMON_LIST) COLLECTOR$(1)

Metaknob arguments will be optional, if the metaknob name is followed by (), then the value in side of the () will be split on , and stripped of leading and trailing whitespace, and then substituted for $(0), $(1), $(2), etc in the value of the metaknob before it is parsed into config statements.

In metaknob statements any $(arg) will be substituted if arg starts with a digit (since that cannot be a valid param name). The substitutions shall be

  • $(0) all of the args
  • $(0?) 1 if any arguments, 0 if no arguments
  • $(0#) the number of arguments (i.e. the number of commas+1)
  • $(1) the first argument
  • $(1?) 1 if the first argument is non-empty, 0 if it is empty
  • $(1+) all of the arguments, starting with the first one. equivalent to $(0)
  • $(2) the second argument
  • $(2?) 1 if the second argument is non-empty, 0 if it is empty
  • $(2+) all of the arguments, starting with the second one
  • $(3) the third argument
  • etc
